pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 488mm; Wbt 43mm; Wsh. 61.5mm; max T 7.0mm; max T bt. 3.7; max T bt. sides (at corner) 2.5; max T. bl sides 3.2; Wt. 563.9 g,Typology: simple lozenge section with flat faces; edges also totally flattened - very neatly,Manufacture: no attempt at creating rivet hoiles; very well trimmed and finished all over, including blunt edges.,Condition: tip [ladening?] - break copper-brown; slight profile bend in lower part of blade.,Attached Material: buff soil traces embedded
pageContext.surface: Fair amounts of light green lumpy corrosion - some pitted; approx. half of surface retains fair green patina; longitud. scratches modern.
pageContext.collection: British Museum, P1989.1-6.1,Lindley, Mrs. M - private (1988)
pageContext.site: England,Essex or Kent,Unknown (see DF): Believed found by Mr. George Lindley, husband of Mrs. Lindley
